revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=April 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox UK place| |country = Scotland |official_name= Achduart |scots_name= |gaelic_name=Achadh Dhubhaird |population= |static_image_name=Achduart with Cairn Conmheall behind.jpg |static_image_caption=Achduart with Cairn Conmheall (541 m) behind |os_grid_reference= NC050037 |map_type=Ross and Cromarty |coordinates = {{coord|57.980272|-5.299201|display=inline,title}} |community_scotland= [[Coigach]] |unitary_scotland= [[Highland (council area)|Highland]] |lieutenancy_scotland= [[Ross and Cromarty]] |constituency_westminster= [[Ross, Skye and Lochaber (UK Parliament constituency)|Ross, Skye and Lochaber]] |constituency_scottish_parliament= [[Caithness, Sutherland and Ross (Scottish Parliament constituency)|Caithness, Sutherland and Ross]] |post_town= |postcode_district = IV26 2 |postcode_area= IV |dial_code= }} '''Achduart''' ([[Scottish Gaelic language|Gaelic]]: '''''Achadh Dhubhaird'''''<ref name="Mac an Tàilleir"/>) is a small hamlet in [[Coigach]], in [[Wester Ross]] in northwestern [[Scotland]], now within the [[Highland (council area)|Highland]] council area.<ref>{{cite map|title=[[Google Maps]]|publisher=Google}}</ref><ref>{{cite map|title=[[Bing Maps]]|publisher= [[Microsoft]] and [[Harris Corporation]] Earthstar Geographics LLC}}</ref> It is situated about 4 km southeast of the village of [[Achiltibuie]], at the end of a minor road. A footpath continues on to the hamlet of Culnacraig, then along the coast past [[Ben More Coigach]] to [[Strathcanaird]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Culnacraig circular|url=http://www.walkhighlands.co.uk/ullapool/culnacraig.shtml|work=Walk Highlands|accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref> Achduart has accommodation facilities for tourists, who come for its proximity to the ocean as well as its seclusion and remoteness. There is a [[Scottish Youth Hostels Association]] hostel in Acheninver, a short distance to the north.
The name of Achduart comes from the Gaelic for "the field at the black headland".<ref name="Mac an Tàilleir">{{cite web|author=Iain Mac an Tàilleir |year=2003 |publisher=[[Scottish Parliament]] |url=http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/vli/language/gaelic/vl-trans.htm |title=Placenames collected by Iain Mac an Tailleir |accessdate=29 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101225005529/http://scottish.parliament.uk/vli/language/gaelic/vl-trans.htm |archivedate=25 December 2010 |url-status = dead}}</ref> Achduart was part of the Estate of Coigach, Lochbroom, belonging to the [[Earl of Cromartie|Countess of Cromartie]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Ct0MAQAAIAAJ&q=Achduart&dq=Achduart|title=Papers by command, Volume 15|publisher=Great Britain. Parliament. House of Commons, HMSO|year=1911|page=78}}</ref>
The dominant geographical feature in the area is [[Cairn Conmheall]], which rises to 541 metres.
==Notable people== *[[Kenny John Macleod]] -fiddler<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UppnAAAAMAAJ&q=Achduart&dq=Achduart|author=Maclean, Calum I. |title=The Highlands|publisher=Mainstream|year=1990|page=203|isbn = 1851583653}}</ref><ref>[https://archive.is/20120729162920/http://www.allcelticmusic.com/music/0b2e6246-6d7b-102b-b651-000f1f67beb1/Wooed_and_Married_and_Aa:_Songs,_Tunes_%26_Customs.html All Celtic Music]</ref>
